body.name: HP Smart -Tank 7301 Wireless All-in-One Cartridge-free Ink Printer, up to 2 years of ink included, mobile print, scan, copy, automatic document feeder (28B70A), Gray
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 1 hr 39 mins
features: BEST FOR BUSY FAMILIES – Print a variety of color documents in high volumes
KEY FEATURES – Print, copy and scan, plus automatic 2-sided printing, 35-page automatic document feeder, borderless prints, mobile and wireless printing. Print up to 15 ppm black and 9 ppm color.
FULLY LOADED WITH SAVINGS – Perfect for low-cost, high-volume printing—up to 2 years of Original HP Ink Bottles included; get up to 8,000 color pages or 6,000 black pages right out of the box
EXCEPTIONAL HP QUALITY – Consistently delivers outstanding color graphics, photos and crisp text for all your prints

SIMPLE, SPILL-FREE REFILL – Replenish ink with HP's easy-access, spill-free refill system. Simply plug the Original HP 32XL Black Bottle or Original HP 31 Color Bottles into the ink tank and let them drain—no squeezing, no spilling.
EASY TO USE – Smart-guided buttons illuminate to guide you through everyday print, scan and copy tasks
ESSENTIAL SECURITY – Protects from viruses, malware and helps maintain privacy and control with basic encryption and password protection
RELIABLE CONNECTIVITY – Self-healing dual-band Wi-FiTM automatically detects and resolves connection issues, and easily share resources with Ethernet networking

HELPING TO PROTECT OUR PLANET – Printer made from recycled materials—more than 25% by weight of plastic. Help stop deforestation and protect wildlife: Use FSC-certified HP-branded paper made with responsibly sourced fiber.
body.description: "The HP Smart Tank 7301 makes printing seamless from start to finish for the whole family with a high-capacity ink tank, automatic document feeder and wireless and Ethernet connectivity. Create outstanding-quality color documents at a low cost with up to two years of Original HP Ink included in the box."

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The ink has been barely touched!!
reviews.reviewText: I print often - for the kids & my business - the ink supply is ridiculous!! It's still going strong, doesn't even look like it's been touched. Amazing!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best HP Printer I Have Owned
reviews.reviewText: I have purchased several HP printers over the years. This one is by far the best one yet. With previous printers, the cost of the replacement ink cartridges would quickly exceed the cost of the printer itself. And the ink cartridges would not last very long; or end up clogging.The ink tank technology on this printer is awesome. I have gone through several packs of paper and the ink levels have barely dropped. If another one of my older HP printers craps out, I am buying another one of these.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Very frustrating set up. Poor customer service.
reviews.reviewText: When I chose this printer, I was looking for a mid-priced, wireless computer. I objected to the automatic ink replacement plan, so that eliminated many of the HP models. HP was my preferred brand, based on past experience —easy set-up, reliable performance for many years, intuitive problem-solving. This HPPrinter is none of the above. Unboxing and initial set-up was easy. As I attempted to connect to WiFi, the process was incredibly confusing. It involved installing the Smart App and visiting 2 other HP sites. After hours of trying to set this upon my own, I decided to contact Customer Service. Customer service involved online links with info that was not user friendly & went in circles. When I attempted to contact a human CSR for free help with set up, I learned that it didn’t exist. I was furious. I finally asked a tech savvy friend to help me with set up. It was also very frustrating for her. It took her more than I hr. to get the printer in operation. If I could have returned it, I would have, but I was beyond the 30 day return period and the large inkreservoirs had already been opened and installed. I have had some minor problems with paper feed, paper jams, etc. which should be easy to resolve. Again, it is not.I am done with HP. If I could rate this zero, I would.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Unbox, find the quick start guide. I used the cord from my previous printer so didn't even have to fish any cords. This one is on the larger side for a home printer, but it still fits in my desk cabinet designed for printers. Adding ink is super easy and zero mess, with countless more ink than the little cartridges I used to get and replace. I love that the new paper goes in the front, and the printed page comes out the front. I also love that the ink volume shows for each color and black on the front. The top controls are a lot easier to see with my old eyes. Setup to my computer and my phone was a snap. I've been using this printer for awhile, and there hasn't been a single blip or bad word said in frustration. Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Printer but not top of the line
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this to replace my ancient Epson WorkForce 635. That worked great for many years before the scanner wouldn't communicate with the computer after upgrade to Windows 11.First Impressions is that the HP is a pretty solid printer. I compared it to another Epson and a Cannon Tank printer before settling on this. Setup was okay, lots of stuff to do and not really plug and play. I wanted to use it with a direct USB connection but HP does not provide that cord. Luckily, the Epson cord worked fine and used that. My son also wants to print, so I set up WIFI but had to actually add the printer as a second printer to use as WIFI. I may have missed something on the setup there, not sure because the instructions are so vague. Like the Tank option vs cartridges. Also has replaceable Print Heads. Time will tell how long the ink lasts. I just use it for home use. Other Criticism is that all the controls are on top vs in the front. Hard to see the buttons if its not mounted at eye level. Also the little display screen is worthless. Anything you want to do, Scan, Print, Copy etc. is best done through the HP Smart App.Last criticism is that there are no card reader slots like the Epson had. Had to buy a USB Card Reader.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far so great
reviews.reviewText: This new tank technology is very cool and makes so much sense. Running great about two months in. The HP app was annoying at first, but it’s growing on me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as advertised
reviews.reviewText: Works great. Fast setup and great quality. I've had this for a little while now and I've got to say that it's great not getting the old "out of ink" msg because you haven't used it in a month. If you're tired of wasting money on ink everytime you use your old printer, then I would recommend this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Replaced old HP
reviews.reviewText: Our old HP cartridge ink all-in-one finally passed on due to failure of its wifi connection system. I suppose it was coincidental with Prime Days and the price seemed reasonable, so we went with the 7301. Easy to setup, including the ink bottles and wifi connections. We certainly like the legal size capabilities, ink tank capacities and two-sided printing. At first, we were a bit put off by not having a "scan button" on the machine, but quickly realized that if we are scanning, the app is needed anyway - no hard button needed any longer. The HP app is intuitive and has been great so far. At some point in the future, I may update this review for durability but for now this is a terrific device.
great quality, easy to set up and use

1- Connection is a nightmare. Sometimes for no reason, you have to reset the wireless settings and get it done from 0.2- Not always detected by laptops or mobiles. You may see it offline but when using the hp app it will be online. I think they should work on its software.Printing quality is 4/10.3- printer bleed ink randomly. Sometimes you see blue dots even if your design is only black.4- hp support will not help you even within the first few weeks and under warranty coverage, they will try everything to prove you have a bad settings, papers, connection, etc.Conclusion: for this price, it’s a total waste of money. Plastic build and material are very cheap for a 450-550$ printer. Now I bought another printer from another brand for more than half of its price and it is performing way better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Happy I won't have to buy ink cartridges
reviews.reviewText: Prints well, scans and copies well, lots of ink in the tanks - it is a great printer and worth the expense.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent product saves lots of money on printing
reviews.reviewText: this printer is exactly what i needed. tired of payingg extraordinary amounts for ink with little amount of pages printed. check out a tank printer. way cheaper.
